DataElement.preferredName: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia Cells Normal Cellularity Code
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Code to signify whether chronic lymphocytic leukemia (CLL) cells are normocellular for a person's age.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia Cells Normal Cellularity Present
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia. It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States. Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes. This type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001)__The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid._Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI)_The degree, quality, or condition of cells that are present._Being or existing in a specified place or at the specified time.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Chronic Lymphocytic Leukemia Cell Normal Cellularity
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia. It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States. Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes. This type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001):The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.:Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm. (NCI):The degree, quality, or condition of cells that are present. (On-line Medical Dictionary)

Concepts.definition: The most common type of chronic lymphoid leukemia.  It comprises 90% of chronic lymphoid leukemias in the United States.  Morphologically, the neoplastic cells are small, round B-lymphocytes.  This type of leukemia is not considered to be curable with available therapy. (WHO, 2001)
The smallest units of living structure capable of independent existence, composed of a membrane-enclosed mass of protoplasm and containing a nucleus or nucleoid.
Being approximately average or within certain limits; conforming with or constituting a norm or standard or level or type or social norm.
The degree, quality, or condition of cells that are present.
